Articles.Content:
We want to introduce you to the KSP Challenge. As the name suggests, we will be opening a thread with a  new challenge on Wednesdays. These challenges will be a place for you to share your achievements. It doesn’t matter if you post screenshots, videos, images or anything you’d like to show off, as long as it goes with the theme of the challenge. We want you to have fun and see all the amazing things you can create!

This week’s theme is:  “Making a hole in one on Moho”

You will have to launch an uncontrolled vessel from a mothership orbiting Moho and get the vessel within Moho’s hole, be sure to launch your craft high up. You are allowed to cheat to orbit and use mods if you want to. All comers welcome. We're sure that experts will think of ingenious ways to make it harder on themselves. Have fun and share your results!

Wait... one question... if the vehicle is uncontrolled, won't it just smash on impact if it's released from orbit?

Or is that OK, so long as it smashes inside the Mo-hole?

Edited March 29, 2017 by Just Jim

Question: when is the deadline? I am going to assume it is next Tuesday/Wednesday, but I am not entirely sure.

If only I had open time...

15 minutes ago, Just Jim said:

Wait... one question... if the vehicle is uncontrolled, won't it just smash on impact if it's released from orbit?

Or is that OK, so long as it smashes inside the Mo-hole?

It's ok to smash the vehicle  

3 minutes ago, Ultimate Steve said:

Question: when is the deadline? I am going to assume it is next Tuesday/Wednesday, but I am not entirely sure.

If only I had open time...

Next Wednesday

Fascinating. Dropping something from an orbiting mothership means it would need to be de-orbited. I realize it must be uncontrolled, but can it have its own propulsion, dumb-fired when staged off?. By which I'm thinking Sepratrons or other SRB's. Maybe there should be a max size for the de-orbit engine, say a Hammer?Otherwise we only have the impulse from decouplers to de-orbit the 'ball.' Which reminds me, does the official "Soccer Ball" mod work in 1.2.2?

Forgive the random skips, I can't do anything about KSP being what it is.

Golf Ball:

Inside the Golf Ball

Many quickloads later:

Apologies for the small gif. Imgur decided it didn't want to upload a 50mb file.

While fine-tuning, I managed to lose the last part at only 323m above "sea" level. My challenge attempt placed the last part a little higher: 338m.

Spoiler

The ship:

Pretty basic stuff.

After launch:

The only reason for so many parts was for fine-tuning. Exactly 44 kilograms of ballast.

The Descent

The Mohole swallows the impactor.


It's not long after this that the probe hits the edge.

The final part explodes.

338m ASL isn't bad, I think.

If anyone cares about my orbital parameters and timing, I'll release them next Wednesday. You probably don't, so I probably won't.
What if I make a hole in one from Kerbin? Will that count?

8 minutes ago, lajoswinkler said:

What if I make a hole in one from Kerbin? Will that count?

Uncontrolled launch from Kerbin? That's at least Hazardish levels of competence. I should hope that that would count.

15 minutes ago, lajoswinkler said:

What if I make a hole in one from Kerbin? Will that count?

Making a artificial hole on Moho by slamming a impacter on its surface at several Km/s could work for another challenge. Believe for this one the requirement is to get in the already existing (and widely known) Mo-hole. Seems hard enough to even exactly overfly the location, given its latitude, coming from any interplanetary uncorrectable orbit; I'm curious to know how you plan to make that.

1 hour ago, diomedea said:

Making a artificial hole on Moho by slamming a impacter on its surface at several Km/s could work for another challenge. Believe for this one the requirement is to get in the already existing (and widely known) Mo-hole. Seems hard enough to even exactly overfly the location, given its latitude, coming from any interplanetary uncorrectable orbit; I'm curious to know how you plan to make that.

At what point does the lack of control have to start? I'm pretty sure I could target the mohole from solar orbit, and if I try harder, from Kerbin's orbit.

1 hour ago, lajoswinkler said:

At what point does the lack of control have to start?

I interpreted the challenge rules as only the 'ball' needing to be uncontrolled, so in this instance it'd be at the point of firing it, surely?

When and where shouldn't make any difference, naturally the further away the more impressive it is. I threw a command chair into the ball because I was worried debris might be treated differently from a ship, however. I don't know if my paranoia is legit or not.

I think I'm gonna go with a 1 m wide spiny ball, like the ones from Super Mario. Seems to have 37 kg. Decoupler can be set to zero force, so I could just back away from it after it's set on its trajectory.

 

I'm not entirely sure one could throw something deep into that pit if control is lost away from Moho. This will be a neat challenge.

5 hours ago, lajoswinkler said:

What if I make a hole in one from Kerbin? Will that count?

"Manley Mode"

Badie: Please see the Challenges... sub-forum for the guidelines on setting challenges. They have developed over time to help proposers and submitters. 

Of particular relevance is that you should firstly post your own attempt of a challenge. I look forward to seeing your submission. 

 

Edited March 30, 2017 by Foxster

19 minutes ago, KAL 9000 said:

"Manley Mode"

I was thinking the same thing...

30 minutes ago, Foxster said:

Badie: Please see the Challenges sub-forum for the rules on setting challenges here. 

Of particular relevance is that you must firstly post your own successful attempt of any challenge set. I look forward to seeing your submission. 

 

In this case I would accept nadir bringing us a sample of someone in the office attempting the challenge. But I agree, this is an existing thing and should at least try to comply with the challenge subforum rules or the reddit challenge rules. 

Proof that it's possible is a really important part; there are faaaar too many challenges that just aren't possible and with sticky permissions your challenges better be top notch.

Highlighting challenges from the challenges subforum would also be a good way to go (and much easier!). No need to take away from their efforts to make your own thing.

1 hour ago, lajoswinkler said:

... Decoupler can be set to zero force, so I could just back away from it after it's set on its trajectory.

 

I'm not entirely sure one could throw something deep into that pit if control is lost away from Moho. This will be a neat challenge.

That makes the mothership be not in orbit, but at most on a suborbital trajectory going itself to impact at the hole location. If that was allowed, would be same to have the mothership just "drop" the ball while flying stationary a few meters above the hole: not orbiting.

Please let me know if you can devise a way to throw something at the hole while even outside Moho's SOI, but still not having the mothership directly aimed at the hole itself. I bet that's possible, but would require more skill than from within the SOI.

6 minutes ago, vosechu said:

In this case I would accept nadir bringing us a sample of someone in the office attempting the challenge. But I agree, this is an existing thing and should at least try to comply with the challenge subforum rules or the reddit challenge rules. 

Proof that it's possible is a really important part; there are faaaar too many challenges that just aren't possible and with sticky permissions your challenges better be top notch.

Please allow me, though I'm not "Squad staff", to show this challenge was successfully tested. Did this days ago, I refrained to show before as my method makes things pretty easy and would take away some of the fun.

Oh, should someone be concerned, I enabled the "No crash" cheat to have the "ball" be intact inside the hole and allow to take the final pictures.

43 minutes ago, Foxster said:

Badie: Please see the Challenges sub-forum for the rules on setting challenges here. 

Of particular relevance is that you must firstly post your own successful attempt of any challenge set. I look forward to seeing your submission. 

 

 

9 minutes ago, vosechu said:

In this case I would accept nadir bringing us a sample of someone in the office attempting the challenge. But I agree, this is an existing thing and should at least try to comply with the challenge subforum rules or the reddit challenge rules. 

Proof that it's possible is a really important part; there are faaaar too many challenges that just aren't possible and with sticky permissions your challenges better be top notch.

Highlighting challenges from the challenges subforum would also be a good way to go (and much easier!). No need to take away from their efforts to make your own thing. 

I don't see any requirement that someone posting a challenge MUST provide proof that the challenge is possible ... Unless I am suffering from SRS (Selective Reading Syndrome)

Please, correct me if I am wrong ...

With that being said, it is customary 'round these parts' to provide some form of proof that the challenge is possible. In this case most of us already know it is, however methinks @Badie should show us her attempt as well as the rest of Squad since it is Squad issuing this challenge 

Just my 4 half-pence

47 minutes ago, Foxster said:

Badie: Please see the Challenges sub-forum for the rules on setting challenges here. 

Of particular relevance is that you must firstly post your own successful attempt of any challenge set. I look forward to seeing your submission. 

 

 

Just to recap...

 

On 4/19/2013 at 8:25 PM, sal_vager said:

Challenge Submission Guide

Is this challenge possible?

Many challenges we see are nearly or literally impossible to achieve, and usually very little thought has gone into them, these challenges just annoy people, waste forum space and show that the submitter hasn't really tried.

So test your challenge yourself first to make sure it is possible, you don't have to be successful but you'll soon know if the challenge has a hope of being completed.

48 minutes ago, Foxster said:

Badie: Please see the Challenges sub-forum for the rules on setting challenges here. 

Of particular relevance is that you must firstly post your own successful attempt of any challenge set. I look forward to seeing your submission. 

 

If you are going to quote rules, at least get them correct. There is no requirement for a successful attempt, it is merely suggested that you consider if the challenge is possible. This one clearly is, so I'm not sure what you're on about.

Edit: Double ninja'd!

Edited March 30, 2017 by Red Iron Crown

3 minutes ago, Red Iron Crown said:

If you are going to quote rules, at least get them correct. There is no requirement for a successful attempt, it is merely suggested that you consider if the challenge is possible. This one clearly is, so I'm not sure what you're on about.

I just wanna see an official SQUAD hole-shot
I´ll do my best to share my submission with you guys

My BOB (Bomb On Board) impactor is ready, in low Kerbin orbit.

 

Now I have to figure out to throw it precisely so that it hits the mohole.

@diomedea After the impactor is released, the probe can move itself away from it and then brake. It doesn't have to follow the impactor.

Edited March 30, 2017 by lajoswinkler

1 minute ago, lajoswinkler said:

 After the impactor is released, the probe can move itself away from it and then brake. It doesn't have to follow the impactor.

It's to you, and to anybody else, to try and find ways they like to meet the challenge. However if the probe isn't in orbit while the ball is launched, you're not really following how the challenge was set up. Being in orbit, means it is required its periapsis is higher than the body surface.
